title: Retail Sales Fell In February But Remain Above Trend
text: Retail sales and food-services spending fell 3.0 percent in February pulling back from a record high in January. Core retail sales, which exclude motor vehicle dealers and gasoline retailers, posted a 3.3 percent drop for the month following a record high in January.

title: 59% of small businesses say health of economy is poor: U.S. Chamber of Commerce
text: Tom Sullivan, VP of Small Business Policy at the U.S. Chamber of Commerce, joins Yahoo Finance's Kristin Myers to breakdown the U.S. Chamber of Commerce small business report.

title: S&P 500 Index: Nearing March Trading Top?
text: The near-term outlook for the S&P 500 Index remains bullish, but perhaps for only a few more days. Given Monday's push higher to test (yet again) the area from mid-February, the near-term structure remains positive and appears ready for another few days of underlying strength to complete this pattern off the early March lows.

title: Jim Cramer on his 2020 lessons: Do not bet on the end of the world
text: "If you only learn one thing from the pandemic … I want you to remember that betting on the end of the world is a sucker's game," the "Mad Money" host said.

title: As Fed gets ready to deliver its interest rate decision, Wells Fargo predicts the 10-year yield could reach 2.25% this year
text: Wells Fargo Securities' Michael Schumacher said he believes the Federal Reserve will let inflation run above its target for "awhile."

title: How High?
text: Everyone will have a reason why markets will not peak at the top, but the historical factor which has helped to time peaks since 1953 is the T-Bill/10yr Treas rate spread. During recessions, pessimism is high and rates across the yield curve are low.

title: US Indexes End Mostly Lower Tuesday
text: The Dow Jones Industrial Average closed at 32,825.95 on Tuesday with a loss of 127.51 points or -0.39%. The S&P 500 closed at 3,962.71 for a loss of 6.23 points or -0.16%.

title: All risk assets in a 'sweet spot' right now as Fed meeting kicks off, says Joe Lavorgna
text: Natixis' Joe Lavorgna says inflation fears are overblown. With Melissa Lee and the Fast Money traders, Guy Adami, Tim Seymour, Dan Nathan and Bonawyn Eison.

title: Twister and taper: The Fed's next move
text: Debating the Fed's next move, with CNBC's Steve Liesman and Melissa Lee, and the Fast Money traders, Guy Adami, Tim Seymour, Dan Nathan and Bonawyn Eison.

title: Bad Weather Contributed To Retail Decline In February, Analysts Say
text: Winter storms, snow and ice put a damper on retail spending in February, resulting in a 3% decline from January.

title: U.S. Stocks Pause As Market Holds Its Breath Ahead Of Key Fed Meeting
text: U.S. stocks faded Tuesday, as investors braced for what could be one of the most important Fed meetings of the coronavirus crisis. The post U.S. Stocks Pause As Market Holds Its Breath Ahead Of Key Fed Meeting appeared first on Investor's Business Daily.

title: The Bull Market Runs On A Diet Of Money: An Analysis Of The Bull's Diet
text: Money pushes stocks higher.

title: US stocks close mixed as investors await Fed guidance on interest rates
text: US stocks closed mixed Tuesday as investors eye the conclusion of the Federal Reserve's policy meeting in which the central bank is expected to release new rate forecasts this week. Fed chair Jerome Powell is expected to give a statement and briefing on Wednesday.

title: Market Recap: Wednesday, March 16: Stocks close near trading session lows
text: Stocks fell on Tuesday, following a session in which the broader market notched new record highs, as traders digested a weaker than expected report on U.S. retail sales and looked ahead to a Federal Reserve policy meeting later this week. ING Chief International Economist James Knightley and JP Morgan Asset Management's Global Market Strategist Jack Manley joined Yahoo Finance Live to discuss.

title: NYU finance professor: Fed can live with rising rates, but depends on why rates rise
text: Aswath Damodaran, NYU finance professor, says as long as the earnings keep up with the rates going up, markets will do fine. But if rates are rising because of inflation, it might cause some concerns for the Fed.

title: High Yield In View: Automobiles And Semiconductors
text: As COVID-19 began to spread across the globe in early 2020, the global automotive industry endured crushing factory shutdowns.

title: Stock Market Today: With Powell On Deck, Investors Hold Their Breath
text: The Dow's seven-day win streak ended Tuesday and stocks broadly struggled as investors looked ahead to Wednesday's FOMC announcements.

title: Markets should fear inflation but the Fed will adapt by raising rates, CEO says
text: Fiona Frick, CEO of asset management firm Unigestion, sees growth returning with a "vengeance" and bringing with it inflation.

title: BofA's global research Michelle Meyer discusses what to expect from Fed meeting
text: Michelle Meyer, Bank of America global research, joins 'Closing Bell' to talk about the state of the markets and what to expect from the Fed meeting.

title: US stocks close mixed session as investors await Fed guidance on interest rates and inflation
text: 4:05pm: US equities drop ahead of Fed guidance US stocks fell in mixed session as investors awaited guidance for the US Federal Reserve on interest rates and inflation. The Dow Jones Industrial Average declined from its record high and snapped a seven-day winning streak amid the passage of the $1.9 trillion stimulus bill.

title: The Market Was Mixed Today. Here's Why.
text: The SPDR Dow Jones Industrial Average ETF Trust (NASDAQ: DIA) hit an all-time high of $330.24 Tuesday before retreating back to $328.86 at the close.  Here are the day's winners and losers from the DIA, according to data from Benzinga Pro.

title: Are Markets Worried by February's Retail Sales Slip?
text: U.S. retail sales took an unexpected dip in February, after surging in January. But markets are unlikely to be concerned by the setback.

title: Savings: The Two-Sided Wildcard For Growth
text: In the first lockdown, surging savings rates across the Western hemisphere were mainly the result of involuntary savings.

title: Fmr. BlackRock executive: ESG investing doesn't have any social impact
text: Tariq Fancy, former BlackRock CIO of sustainable investing, wrote an op-ed stating that "the financial services industry is duping the American public with pro-environment, sustainable investing practices." He says there is no evidence ESG investing has any social impact.

title: Billionaire investor Howard Marks rejects notion that the stock market is in a bubble, arguing asset prices are still in a reasonable 'gray area'
text: Billionaire investor Howard Marks rejected the notion that the stock market is currently in a bubble and said that most asset prices are still justifiable in his latest investor memo. While other major investors like Jeremy Grantham are calling for the top of the market, Marks said the future trajectory of the market is less clear.

title: Bill Gross Sees 3%-4% Inflation Ahead for the U.S.
text: Mar.16 -- Bill Gross, co-founder of Pacific Investment Management Co. (Pimco), says he was short Treasuries going into the recent selloff. He speaks with Bloomberg's Erik Schatzker on "Bloomberg Markets: The Close.

title: Municipal bond market spreads look pretty attractive: Goldman Sachs Assett Management
text: Scott Diamond Golman Sachs Asset Management spoke with Yahoo Finance's Kristin Myers about the municipal bond market.

title: Charles Schwab's Liz Ann Sonders on value in the market
text: Liz Ann Sonders, Charles Schwab chief investment strategist, joins 'Power Lunch' to discuss where investors can value in the market.

title: Inflation is one of the biggest risk to markets in 2022 and 2023: Northwestern Mutual Wealth Mgmt.
text: Yahoo Finance's Kristin Myers spoke with Northwestern Mutual Wealth Management's Brent Schutte about the outlook for stocks, inflation, the Fed and the outlook for economic recovery.

title: Why Are Interest Rates Rising…and What Does It Mean for the Stock Market?
text: By Chris Konstantinos, CFA Why RiverFront is not yet concerned about recent rise in rates After a prolonged period of hovering near all-time lows, the US 10-year Treasury yield has been on the move lately (see chart).  This is not wholly unexpected, nor it is necessarily something for the stock market to be concerned about, [.

title: U.S. Stock ETFs Mixed with Tech on the Mend
text: U.S. markets and stock exchange traded funds wavered Tuesday as investors focused on the battered tech segment. On Tuesday, the Invesco QQQ Trust (NASDAQ: QQQ) was up 0.9%, SPDR Dow Jones Industrial Average ETF (NYSEArca: DIA) fell 0.5%, and iShares Core S&P 500 ETF (NYSEArca: IVV) was 0.1% lower.

title: Stock ETFs Stall Near Recent Highs as FOMC Approaches
text: Stock index ETFs were mixed on Tuesday, with tech stocks and ETFs pushing higher as other sectors languished. Meanwhile, Federal Reserve officials commenced their March meeting.

title: Oil futures finish lower on weaker demand outlook, expectations for a rise in supplies
text: Oil futures fell on Tuesday, pressured ahead of data that are expected to show a fourth straight weekly increase in U.S. crude supply, and as Europe's vaccine rollout hit a snag. Some European countries suspended the use of AstraZeneca's COVID-19 vaccine and "that should diminish the crude demand outlook in the short term," said Edward Moya, senior analyst at Oanda.

title: Chip stocks lead tech higher; Google, Apple cut app store fees in half; GameStop down 25% in 2 days
text: Yahoo Finance's Jared Blikre reports the latest stock market news.

title: Federal Reserve faces a communications test at its meeting this week as the economy improves
text: The challenge will be to assure investors that even if the status quo remains, it won't provoke policymakers to change course.

title: Balance between value and growth stocks right now: Strategist
text: CNBC's Brian Sullivan discusses the market rebound from the pandemic lows and what's next with Tracie McMillon of Wells Fargo Investment Institute and Jeff Krumpelman of Mariner Wealth Advisors. title: Stocks In Bondage But Fed Not Fazed
text: The Fed has shown it has a number of tricks for rigging the bond market to match the price controls of the central planners and rigging the stock market if the plunge gets scary enough, especially now that it has the help of the federal government.

title: Inflation Is a Bigger Risk to the Bull Market Than Covid-19, Fund Managers Say
text: Respondents to a BofA Securities survey also put a bond-market taper tantrum ahead of the virus.

title: Dow pulls back from record, snaps winning streak ahead of Fed decision
text: Stocks ended mostly lower Tuesday as investors looked ahead to the conclusion of a Federal Reserve policy meeting. The Dow Jones Industrial Average fell around 128 points, or 0.4%, to close near 32,826, snapping a seven-day winning streak and a string of four consecutive record finishes.

title: The Legendary 2-10 Spread Is Now 6-For-6
text: Since we closed at a fresh 52-week high for both the 2-10 spread and the 10-year Treasury yield last Friday, further rises in long-term interest rates will likely cause a bigger rotation out of technology stocks and into financials, industrials and the energy sector.

title: S&P 500 rises to new highs as investors keep their focus on Fed
text: S&P 500 hit fresh record highs this week despite rising yields that have facilitated a correction in some parts of the stock market recently.  Fundamental analysis: All about bond yields Blue-chip stocks like Apple, Tesla, and Amazon have been lagging behind lately as investors focus on cyclical stocks that thrive during the economic recovery.

title: U.S. stocks finish mostly lower as investors await Fed meeting
text: U.S. stocks finish mostly lower as investors await Fed meeting

title: How Did Investors Deal With Market Volatility in 2020?
text: Investors viewed and reacted to 2020's market volatility in very different ways.

text: CNBC's Brian Sullivan discusses the Covid relief plan and the economic recovery with Jared Bernstein, member of the White House Council of Economic Advisers. title: After A Free Fall Last March, We're Up 80+% In A Year
text: One year ago today, on Monday, March 16, 2020, the Dow Jones Industrials fell by a record 3,000 points on a record-high 82.7 VIX reading. The market's nadir came on Monday, March 23. In just under a year, ending last Friday, the Dow and S&P 500 rose over 80%, while Nasdaq is up 114% and the Russell 2000 is up an astounding 143.6%.

title: Get Ready To Rumble If Vaccines End The Pandemic
text: Most seem to agree that the cause of February's market turbulence was the speed of the selloff in Treasuries, not the direction. The dollar should be a lot weaker if the Fed is artificially depressing real interest rates below equilibrium.

title: Treasury yields come off highs after strong debt auction
text: Treasury yields retreated from their highs after buyers showed up in force at a 20-year bond auction on Tuesday afternoon. The 20-year bond fell sharply from its intraday high of around 2.315% down to 2.271%.

title: Wall Street VIX 'fear gauge' slips to fresh pandemic low
text: The Cboe Volatility Index, known as Wall Street's "fear gauge," slipped to a fresh COVID-19 pandemic low on Tuesday, as U.S. stocks soared to new heights ahead of this week's two-day Federal Reserve policy meeting.

title: S&P 500 Hits All-Time High
text: Mar.16 -- Miller Tabak Chief Market Strategist Matt Maley speaks with Bloomberg's Alix Steel and Guy Johnson about the S&P 500 hitting an all-time high as VIX meets tough resistance on "Bloomberg Markets:".

title: How The Fed's Inflation Is Driving Stock Buybacks
text: It is true that company managers are shareholder agents - and are obligated to pursue projects to the end of wealth maximization. The reason the rate of monetary expansion makes sense as a measure of required rate of return has to do with the fact this is essentially inflation in and of itself, devaluing the monetary units that are held by the public.
